items.name: dropdown
items.label: Angular 8 Dropdown
items.description: An accordion is a simple component that can be easily coded in pure HTML and css, but with the help of Angular you can add some more goodies, like having a default item selected and hiding the current selection from the list.

items.name: accordion
items.label: Angular 8 Accordion
items.description: An accordion and is a component which displays all the key information while leaving the user the possibility to find out more about each item by clicking on them.

items.name: sidebar
items.label: Sidebar
items.description: Every website needs a sidebar. This sidebar relies on CSS translations.

items.name: retirement-calculator
items.label: Retirement Calculator
items.description: Lately I have been reeding up on the FIRE movement and I decided to crunch up the numbers to see how far I am from retirement. After that, I thought I would develop an angular form to share the calculator I created.

items.name: sudoku
items.label: Sudoku
items.description: A sudoku puzzle is a very fun component to develop. However, it's deceptively hard to implement. The tricky bit is the service that generates the sudoku's solution.

items.name: modal
items.label: Modal
items.description: Modals are some of the most useful components for web development. It pays off to develop a simple re-usable component. In this example I am using angular transclusion, to pass in some custom HTML elements for the body and the footer. That allows for maximum modularity and re-usability.
